amendment.description: An amendment numbered 34 printed in the Congressional Record to prohibit the use of funds to be used by United States Government to seize or otherwise take possession of, other than for value givern in a sale or exchange, any coins, medal or numismatic item made by the U.S. Government.

action.text: Mr. Serrano raised a point of order against the Lucas amendment (A015). Mr. Serrano stated that the amendment seeks to change existing law and constitutes legislation in an appropriationbill. The Chair sustained the point of order.
